RE: The Thirty Nine Steps
I've seen the 1935 version, and the 1978 version, http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0078389/, and IT is the only one worth watching, imho (rather fond memories re-watching a bad vhs copy recorded during a rainstorm with my ex-wife--it was one of our favorites).  IMDB does not mention one made with Jimmy Stewart, although a 1959 version follows the Hitchcock original fairly closely
